title: Payload for child of block root 0x8677898596167f60163efb5a6dd66140aaa4094931a0f55c9be9452531c34295 was invalid
body:
### Description
getting logs littered with `Payload for child of block root 0x8677898596167f60163efb5a6dd66140aaa4094931a0f55c9be9452531c34295 was invalid` and at least for the last hour teku does not seem to sync anymore

**Expected behavior:** [What you expect to happen]
sync and not throw warning logs

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happens]
```
2022-10-03 06:56:57.127 INFO  - Listening on https://0.0.0.0:7500/
```

**Frequency:**  all the time now

### Versions (Add all that apply)
* Software version: teku/v22.9.1/linux-x86_64/-eclipseadoptium-openjdk64bitservervm-java-17
* Docker Version: 20.10.18

What execution client do you use? Could you share execution client logs for the same time?
Your log shows that Teku submits payload of descendant of the block #4828224 and EL answers that payload is invalid

that was with go-ethereum, seems i had somhow a corrupted chain db. seeing that there are two chains, it would of helped me get to the root of the issue sooner if the message would of given a clearer indication that that root belongs to an execution chain block i guess

/edit gonna close this, thanks, had to resync geth + teku but it works now, took most of the day :|
Thanks for the feedback, I've tried to update message to make clear that it's linked with Execution Client.
